metadata.dc:author: Lobato Busto, Ramón
Gelabert-González, Miguel
Cascallar Caneda, Luis
Reyes Santías, Rosa María
Arán-Echabe, Eduardo
Varela Pazo, Ana
metadata.dc:description: Stereotactic radiosurgery undoubtedly represents an important therapeutic procedure for various intracranial pathologies, especially tumours, although they are not entirely complication-free. Radiosurgery have been considered a good management strategy for the majority of small-to-medium size vestibular schwannomas. The authors describe a case of high-grade glioma associated with a previous radiosurgery treatment for a vestibular schwannoma in a 69 year-old woman. A detailed description of these cases is provided, as well as a summary of the related literature.
metadata.dc:subject: Radiocirugía
Radiation-induced neoplasms
High grade glioma
Radiosurgery
Glioma de alto grado
Neoplasia radioinducida
Schwannoma del nervio vestibular
Vestibular schwannoma
metadata.dc:title: Glioma radioinducido secundario a tratamiento radioquirúrgico de un schwannoma del nervio vestibular.
[High-grade glioma after stereotactic radiosurgery for vestibular schwannoma].
